programme.title: The Cinema List: Jurassic (2025)
programme.desc: Welcome to a Cinema List 65 million years in the making, going through the best moments from the Jurassic franchise - from the 1993 original to Jurassic World: Dominion.

programme.title: Star Trek: Generations
programme.desc: Science-fiction adventure starring Patrick Stewart and featuring William Shatner. When an evil alien threatens to destroy a star system along with millions of lives, Captain Jean-Luc Picard travels into a time vortex to enlist the help of his famous predecessor, James T Kirk.

programme.title: The Back-up Plan
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Jennifer Lopez. With no man in her life and her biological clock ticking away, Zoe opts to have artificial insemination to have the baby she craves. Then she meets Stan and the two embark on a relationship, and Zoe faces the awkward prospect of explaining to him all about her increasingly noticeable bump.

programme.title: Aisha
programme.desc: Drama starring Letitia Wright and Josh O'Connor. Aisha, a young Nigerian woman, is attempting to seek asylum in Ireland. Struggling to navigate bureaucratic obstacles, she forms a bond with Conor, a security guard at the Dublin detention centre where she is living in limbo. But as their friendship develops, Aisha's future in the country remains uncertain.

programme.title: Arrival
programme.desc: Science-fiction drama starring Amy Adams and Jeremy Renner. After 12 alien spacecraft land in locations around the world, linguistics professor Louise Banks is called in to try to decipher the visitors' language and open a line of communication. Do they come in peace or is humankind on the brink of war?

programme.title: Star Trek: First Contact
programme.desc: Sci-fi adventure starring Patrick Stewart. During a Federation encounter with the Borg, a sphere escapes into the Earth's past via a temporal vortex. Captain Jean-Luc Picard and the crew of the Enterprise take up the challenge to pursue the Federation's most fearsome enemy and stop them from changing the future.

programme.title: Horizon: An American Saga: Chapter 1
programme.desc: In 1859 families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas. Meanwhile, a gruff cowboy soon finds himself on the run with a prostitute and a young boy after killing a fellow gunman.

programme.title: The Gilded Age
programme.desc: Bertha deals with unwanted rumors in the press and the surprise arrival of her sister Monica.

programme.title: We Live in Time
programme.desc: A surprise encounter brings together a couple, changing the course of their lives. Challenged by the limits of time, they learn to cherish each moment of their decade-spanning and movingly rare love story.

programme.title: The Last House on the Left
programme.desc: After their daughter is assaulted and left for dead, a couple (Tony Goldwyn, Monica Potter) take revenge on the assailants, who have taken shelter at the couple's house.

programme.title: Joker
programme.desc: Isolated, bullied and disregarded by society, failed comedian Arthur Fleck begins a slow descent into madness as he transforms into the criminal mastermind known as the Joker.

programme.title: Joker: Folie Ã Deux
programme.desc: Struggling with his dual identity, failed comedian Arthur Fleck stumbles upon true love while incarcerated at Arkham State Hospital. Awaiting trial for the murder of five people, Fleck soon discovers the music that's always been inside him.

programme.title: Valerian and the City of a Thousand Planets
programme.desc: In the 28th century, two special operatives (Dane DeHaan, Cara Delevingne) race against time to save the diverse city of Alpha from a dark force that also jeopardizes the future of the universe.

programme.title: Babygirl
programme.desc: A high-powered CEO puts her career and family on the line when she begins a torrid affair with her much younger intern.

programme.title: Sing Sing
programme.desc: A man is imprisoned at Sing Sing for a crime he didn't commit. When joined by a wary outsider, he finds purpose in staging an original comedy with a theater group of other incarcerated men.

programme.title: Jackie
programme.desc: The assassination of JFK is seen through the eyes of Jackie Kennedy. The days leading up to the tragedy and the immediate aftermath are chronicled, as experienced by the First Lady, wife of the charismatic president and mother of two small children.

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A doctor's invention allows a couple (Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet) to erase the memories of their tumultuous relationship.

programme.title: Elizabeth Taylor: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: An unprecedented exploration into the life of Elizabeth Taylor, Hollywood's quintessential star. Access to Taylor's personal archives and hours of newly unearthed, intimate audio interviews with journalist Richard Meryman.

programme.title: My Mom Jayne
programme.desc: Mariska Hargitay's journey to understand and embrace the public and private legacy of her mother, Hollywood icon Jayne Mansfield.

programme.title: The Big Year
programme.desc: Three men (Steve Martin, Jack Black, Owen Wilson) race around North America in a prestigious contest to see who can spot the greatest number of bird species in a single year.

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Walter Keane (Christoph Waltz) achieves worldwide fame for pop-art portraits of saucer-eyed waifs, but no one knows that it's his wife, Margaret (Amy Adams), who's the real genius behind the paintbrush.

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: Imprisoned within the Great Wall of China, a mercenary warrior (Matt Damon) joins forces with an elite army to battle an onslaught of marauding monsters.

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: Perseus (Sam Worthington), the son of Zeus (Liam Neeson), embarks on a dangerous mission to prevent Hades (Ralph Fiennes) from toppling the king of the gods and laying waste to Earth.

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A dope-smoking private detective (Joaquin Phoenix) navigates a psychedelic world of surfers, rockers, stoners, LAPD cops and more as he looks for a missing ex-girlfriend and her wealthy boyfriend.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: After a wild stag party in Las Vegas, three hazy groomsmen (Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis) must find their missing friend and get him back to Los Angeles in time for his wedding.

programme.title: The Last Days on Mars
programme.desc: Astronauts (Liev Schreiber, Elias Koteas, Romola Garai) on Mars contend with a microbe that turns those it infects into zombielike killers.

programme.title: The Bank Job
programme.desc: In 1971 London, a car dealer (Jason Statham) and his gang of thieves break into a bank vault and find far more than cash and jewelry.

programme.title: Beau Is Afraid
programme.desc: A paranoid man embarks on a darkly funny and nightmarish odyssey to get home to his mother.

programme.title: Batman: Mask of the Phantasm
programme.desc: Bruce Wayne's former love is implicated in a mysterious new villain's lethal campaign against crime lords.

programme.title: The Batman
programme.desc: Batman ventures into Gotham City's underworld when a sadistic killer leaves behind a trail of cryptic clues. As the scale of the perpetrator's plans become clear, he must bring justice to the abuse of power and corruption that plagues the metropolis.

programme.title: The Insurrectionist Next Door
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi turns her camera on people who stormed the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021; through interviews conducted over two years, Pelosi talks to individuals charged with crimes for their participation in the unprecedented events of the day.

programme.title: Stopping The Steal
programme.desc: An inside account of President Trump's challenge to the results of the 2020 presidential election as told by former White House staff and appointees.
A time traveler risks his life to change the course of history and save the future of humanity.

programme.title: Surveilled
programme.desc: Journalist Ronan Farrow investigates the growing commercial spyware industry - and the ethical dilemmas of 21st century cyberespionage.

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A gravely ill comic (Adam Sandler) takes a struggling performer (Seth Rogen) under his wing, then gets a chance to re-evaluate his life when his disease goes into remission.
